title: Hearst Castle
summary: Hearst Castle, known formally as La Cuesta Encantada (Spanish for "The Enchanted Hill"), is a historic, palatial estate in San Simeon, California, located on the Central Coast of California. Conceived by William Randolph Hearst, the publishing tycoon, and his architect Julia Morgan, the castle was built between 1919-47. Today, Hearst Castle is a museum open to the public as a California State Park and registered as a National Historic Landmark and California Historical Landmark.
